00061 static void osd_push_ctxt(const struct osd_device *dev,
00062                           struct lvfs_run_ctxt *newctxt,
00063                           struct lvfs_run_ctxt *save)
00064 {
00065         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(newctxt);
00066         newctxt->pwdmnt = dev->od_mnt;
00067         newctxt->pwd = dev->od_mnt->mnt_root;
00068         newctxt->fs = get_ds();
00069         newctxt->umask = current_umask();
00070         newctxt->dt = NULL;
00071 
00072         push_ctxt(save, newctxt);
00073 }
00074 
00075 /* utility to make a directory */
00076 static struct dentry *simple_mkdir(struct dentry *dir, struct vfsmount *mnt,
00077                                    const char *name, int mode, int fix)
00078 {
00079         struct dentry *dchild;
00080         int err = 0;
00081         ENTRY;
00082 
00083         // ASSERT_KERNEL_CTXT("kernel doing mkdir outside kernel context\n");
00084         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "creating directory %.*s\n", (int)strlen(name), name);
00085         dchild = ll_lookup_one_len(name, dir, strlen(name));
00086         if (IS_ERR(dchild))
00087                 GOTO(out_up, dchild);
00088 
00089         if (dchild->d_inode) {
00090                 int old_mode = dchild->d_inode->i_mode;
00091                 if (!S_ISDIR(old_mode)) {
00092                         CERROR("found %s (%lu/%u) is mode %o\n", name,
00093                                dchild->d_inode->i_ino,
00094                                dchild->d_inode->i_generation, old_mode);
00095                         GOTO(out_err, err = -ENOTDIR);
00096                 }
00097 
00098                 /* Fixup directory permissions if necessary */
00099                 if (fix && (old_mode & S_IALLUGO) != (mode & S_IALLUGO)) {
00100                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG,
00101                                "fixing permissions on %s from %o to %o\n",
00102                                name, old_mode, mode);
00103                         dchild->d_inode->i_mode = (mode & S_IALLUGO) |
00104                                                   (old_mode & ~S_IALLUGO);
00105                         mark_inode_dirty(dchild->d_inode);
00106                 }
00107                 GOTO(out_up, dchild);
00108         }
00109 
00110         err = vfs_mkdir(dir->d_inode, dchild, mode);
00111         if (err)
00112                 GOTO(out_err, err);
00113 
00114         RETURN(dchild);
00115 
00116 out_err:
00117         dput(dchild);
00118         dchild = ERR_PTR(err);
00119 out_up:
00120         return dchild;
00121 }
00122 
00123 static int osd_last_rcvd_subdir_count(struct osd_device *osd)
00124 {
00125         struct lr_server_data lsd;
00126         struct dentry        *dlast;
00127         loff_t                off;
00128         int                   rc = 0;
00129         int                   count = OBJ_SUBDIR_COUNT;
00130 
00131         ENTRY;
00132 
00133         dlast = ll_lookup_one_len(LAST_RCVD, osd_sb(osd)->s_root,
00134                                   strlen(LAST_RCVD));
00135         if (IS_ERR(dlast))
00136                 return PTR_ERR(dlast);
00137         else if (dlast->d_inode == NULL)
00138                 goto out;
00139 
00140         off = 0;
00141         rc = osd_ldiskfs_read(dlast->d_inode, &lsd, sizeof(lsd), &off);
00142         if (rc == sizeof(lsd)) {
00143                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "read last_rcvd header, uuid = %s, "
00144                        "subdir count = %d\n", lsd.lsd_uuid,
00145                        lsd.lsd_subdir_count);
00146                 if (le16_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_subdir_count) > 0)
00147                         count = le16_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_subdir_count);
00148         } else if (rc != 0) {
00149                 CERROR("Can't read last_rcvd file, rc = %d\n", rc);
00150                 if (rc > 0)
00151                         rc = -EFAULT;
00152                 dput(dlast);
00153                 return rc;
00154         }
00155 out:
00156         dput(dlast);
00157         LASSERT(count > 0);
00158         return count;
00159 }
00160 
00161 static const char remote_parent_dir[] = "REMOTE_PARENT_DIR";
00162 static int osd_mdt_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev)
00163 {
00164         struct lvfs_run_ctxt    new;
00165         struct lvfs_run_ctxt    save;
00166         struct dentry           *parent;
00167         struct osd_mdobj_map    *omm;
00168         struct dentry           *d;
00169         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00170         struct lu_fid           *fid = &info->oti_fid3;
00171         int                     rc = 0;
00172         ENTRY;
00173 
00174         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(dev->od_mdt_map);
00175         if (dev->od_mdt_map == NULL)
00176                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00177 
00178         omm = dev->od_mdt_map;
00179 
00180         parent = osd_sb(dev)->s_root;
00181         osd_push_ctxt(dev, &new, &save);
00182 
00183         d = simple_mkdir(parent, dev->od_mnt, remote_parent_dir,
00184                          0755, 1);
00185         if (IS_ERR(d))
00186                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = PTR_ERR(d));
00187 
00188         omm->omm_remote_parent = d;
00189 
00190         /* Set LMA for remote parent inode */
00191         lu_local_obj_fid(fid, REMOTE_PARENT_DIR_OID);
00192         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, d->d_inode, fid, LMAC_NOT_IN_OI, 0);
00193 
00194         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00195 
00196 cleanup:
00197         pop_ctxt(&save, &new);
00198         if (rc) {
00199                 if (omm->omm_remote_parent != NULL)
00200                         dput(omm->omm_remote_parent);
00201                 OBD_FREE_PTR(omm);
00202                 dev->od_mdt_map = NULL;
00203         }
00204         return rc;
00205 }
00206 
00207 static void osd_mdt_fini(struct osd_device *osd)
00208 {
00209         struct osd_mdobj_map *omm = osd->od_mdt_map;
00210 
00211         if (omm == NULL)
00212                 return;
00213 
00214         if (omm->omm_remote_parent)
00215                 dput(omm->omm_remote_parent);
00216 
00217         OBD_FREE_PTR(omm);
00218         osd->od_ost_map = NULL;
00219 }
00220 
00221 int osd_add_to_remote_parent(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00222                              struct osd_object *obj, struct osd_thandle *oh)
00223 {
00224         struct osd_mdobj_map    *omm = osd->od_mdt_map;
00225         struct osd_thread_info  *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
00226         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma = &oti->oti_mdt_attrs;
00227         char                    *name = oti->oti_name;
00228         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00229         struct dentry           *dentry;
00230         struct dentry           *parent;
00231         int                     rc;
00232 
00233         /* Set REMOTE_PARENT in lma, so other process like unlink or lfsck
00234          * can identify this object quickly */
00235         rc = osd_get_lma(oti, obj->oo_inode, &oti->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
00236         if (rc != 0)
00237                 RETURN(rc);
00238 
00239         lma->lma_incompat |= LMAI_REMOTE_PARENT;
00240         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00241         rc = __osd_xattr_set(oti, obj->oo_inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA, lma,
00242                              sizeof(*lma), XATTR_REPLACE);
00243         if (rc != 0)
00244                 RETURN(rc);
00245 
00246         parent = omm->omm_remote_parent;
00247         sprintf(name, DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu)));
00248         dentry = osd_child_dentry_by_inode(env, parent->d_inode,
00249                                            name, strlen(name));
00250         mutex_lock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00251         rc = osd_ldiskfs_add_entry(info, oh->ot_handle, dentry,
00252                                    obj->oo_inode, NULL);
00253         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "%s: add %s:%lu to remote parent %lu.\n", osd_name(osd),
00254                name, obj->oo_inode->i_ino, parent->d_inode->i_ino);
00255         ldiskfs_inc_count(oh->ot_handle, parent->d_inode);
00256         mark_inode_dirty(parent->d_inode);
00257         mutex_unlock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00258         RETURN(rc);
00259 }
00260 
00261 int osd_delete_from_remote_parent(const struct lu_env *env,
00262                                   struct osd_device *osd,
00263                                   struct osd_object *obj,
00264                                   struct osd_thandle *oh)
00265 {
00266         struct osd_mdobj_map       *omm = osd->od_mdt_map;
00267         struct osd_thread_info     *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
00268         struct lustre_mdt_attrs    *lma = &oti->oti_mdt_attrs;
00269         char                       *name = oti->oti_name;
00270         struct dentry              *dentry;
00271         struct dentry              *parent;
00272         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
00273         struct buffer_head         *bh;
00274         int                        rc;
00275 
00276         /* Check lma to see whether it is remote object */
00277         rc = osd_get_lma(oti, obj->oo_inode, &oti->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
00278         if (rc != 0)
00279                 RETURN(rc);
00280 
00281         if (likely(!(lma->lma_incompat & LMAI_REMOTE_PARENT)))
00282                 RETURN(0);
00283 
00284         parent = omm->omm_remote_parent;
00285         sprintf(name, DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->oo_dt.do_lu)));
00286         dentry = osd_child_dentry_by_inode(env, parent->d_inode,
00287                                            name, strlen(name));
00288         mutex_lock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00289         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(parent->d_inode, &dentry->d_name, &de,
00290                                     NULL, NULL);
00291         if (bh == NULL) {
00292                 mutex_unlock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00293                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00294         }
00295         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "%s: el %s:%lu to remote parent %lu.\n", osd_name(osd),
00296                name, obj->oo_inode->i_ino, parent->d_inode->i_ino);
00297         rc = ldiskfs_delete_entry(oh->ot_handle, parent->d_inode, de, bh);
00298         ldiskfs_dec_count(oh->ot_handle, parent->d_inode);
00299         mark_inode_dirty(parent->d_inode);
00300         mutex_unlock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00301         brelse(bh);
00302 
00303         /* Get rid of REMOTE_PARENT flag from incompat */
00304         lma->lma_incompat &= ~LMAI_REMOTE_PARENT;
00305         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00306         rc = __osd_xattr_set(oti, obj->oo_inode, XATTR_NAME_LMA, lma,
00307                              sizeof(*lma), XATTR_REPLACE);
00308         RETURN(rc);
00309 }
00310 
00311 int osd_lookup_in_remote_parent(struct osd_thread_info *oti,
00312                                 struct osd_device *osd,
00313                                 const struct lu_fid *fid,
00314                                 struct osd_inode_id *id)
00315 {
00316         struct osd_mdobj_map        *omm = osd->od_mdt_map;
00317         char                        *name = oti->oti_name;
00318         struct dentry               *parent;
00319         struct dentry               *dentry;
00320         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
00321         struct buffer_head         *bh;
00322         int                         rc;
00323         ENTRY;
00324 
00325         parent = omm->omm_remote_parent;
00326         sprintf(name, DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(fid));
00327         dentry = osd_child_dentry_by_inode(oti->oti_env, parent->d_inode,
00328                                            name, strlen(name));
00329         mutex_lock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00330         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(parent->d_inode, &dentry->d_name, &de,
00331                                     NULL, NULL);
00332         if (bh == NULL) {
00333                 rc = -ENOENT;
00334         } else {
00335                 rc = 0;
00336                 osd_id_gen(id, le32_to_cpu(de->inode), OSD_OII_NOGEN);
00337                 brelse(bh);
00338         }
00339         mutex_unlock(&parent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00340         if (rc == 0)
00341                 osd_add_oi_cache(oti, osd, id, fid);
00342         RETURN(rc);
00343 }
00344 
00345 /*
00346  * directory structure on legacy OST:
00347  *
00348  * O/<seq>/d0-31/<objid>
00349  * O/<seq>/LAST_ID
00350  * last_rcvd
00351  * LAST_GROUP
00352  * CONFIGS
00353  *
00354  */
00355 static int osd_ost_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev)
00356 {
00357         struct lvfs_run_ctxt     new;
00358         struct lvfs_run_ctxt     save;
00359         struct dentry           *rootd = osd_sb(dev)->s_root;
00360         struct dentry           *d;
00361         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00362         struct inode            *inode;
00363         struct lu_fid           *fid = &info->oti_fid3;
00364         int                      rc;
00365         ENTRY;
00366 
00367         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(dev->od_ost_map);
00368         if (dev->od_ost_map == NULL)
00369                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00370 
00371         /* to get subdir count from last_rcvd */
00372         rc = osd_last_rcvd_subdir_count(dev);
00373         if (rc < 0)
00374                 GOTO(cleanup_alloc, rc);
00375 
00376         dev->od_ost_map->om_subdir_count = rc;
00377         rc = 0;
00378 
00379         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->od_ost_map->om_seq_list);
00380         rwlock_init(&dev->od_ost_map->om_seq_list_lock);
00381         mutex_init(&dev->od_ost_map->om_dir_init_mutex);
00382 
00383         osd_push_ctxt(dev, &new, &save);
00384 
00385         d = ll_lookup_one_len("O", rootd, strlen("O"));
00386         if (IS_ERR(d))
00387                 GOTO(cleanup_ctxt, rc = PTR_ERR(d));
00388         if (d->d_inode == NULL) {
00389                 dput(d);
00390                 /* The lookup() may be called again inside simple_mkdir().
00391                  * Since the repeated lookup() only be called for "/O" at
00392                  * mount time, it will not affect the whole performance. */
00393                 d = simple_mkdir(rootd, dev->od_mnt, "O", 0755, 1);
00394                 if (IS_ERR(d))
00395                         GOTO(cleanup_ctxt, rc = PTR_ERR(d));
00396 
00397                 /* It is quite probably that the device is new formatted. */
00398                 dev->od_maybe_new = 1;
00399         }
00400 
00401         inode = d->d_inode;
00402         dev->od_ost_map->om_root = d;
00403 
00404         /* 'What the @fid is' is not imporatant, because the object
00405          * has no OI mapping, and only is visible inside the OSD.*/
00406         lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00407         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid,
00408                     LMAC_NOT_IN_OI | LMAC_FID_ON_OST, 0);
00409         if (rc)
00410                 GOTO(cleanup_dentry, rc);
00411 
00412         pop_ctxt(&save, &new);
00413         RETURN(0);
00414 
00415 cleanup_dentry:
00416         dput(d);
00417 cleanup_ctxt:
00418         pop_ctxt(&save, &new);
00419 cleanup_alloc:
00420         OBD_FREE_PTR(dev->od_ost_map);
00421         return rc;
00422 }
00423 
00424 static void osd_seq_free(struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq)
00425 {
00426         int j;
00427 
00428         if (osd_seq->oos_dirs) {
00429                 for (j = 0; j < osd_seq->oos_subdir_count; j++) {
00430                         if (osd_seq->oos_dirs[j])
00431                                 dput(osd_seq->oos_dirs[j]);
00432                 }
00433                 OBD_FREE(osd_seq->oos_dirs,
00434                          sizeof(struct dentry *) * osd_seq->oos_subdir_count);
00435         }
00436 
00437         if (osd_seq->oos_root)
00438                 dput(osd_seq->oos_root);
00439 
00440         OBD_FREE_PTR(osd_seq);
00441 }
00442 
00443 static void osd_ost_fini(struct osd_device *osd)
00444 {
00445         struct osd_obj_seq    *osd_seq;
00446         struct osd_obj_seq    *tmp;
00447         struct osd_obj_map    *map = osd->od_ost_map;
00448         ENTRY;
00449 
00450         if (map == NULL)
00451                 return;
00452 
00453         write_lock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00454         list_for_each_entry_safe(osd_seq, tmp, &map->om_seq_list,
00455                                  oos_seq_list) {
00456                 list_del_init(&osd_seq->oos_seq_list);
00457                 write_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00458                 osd_seq_free(osd_seq);
00459                 write_lock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00460         }
00461         write_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00462         if (map->om_root)
00463                 dput(map->om_root);
00464         OBD_FREE_PTR(map);
00465         osd->od_ost_map = NULL;
00466         EXIT;
00467 }
00468 
00469 int osd_obj_map_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev)
00470 {
00471         int rc;
00472         ENTRY;
00473 
00474         /* prepare structures for OST */
00475         rc = osd_ost_init(env, dev);
00476         if (rc)
00477                 RETURN(rc);
00478 
00479         /* prepare structures for MDS */
00480         rc = osd_mdt_init(env, dev);
00481         if (rc)
00482                 osd_ost_fini(dev);
00483 
00484         RETURN(rc);
00485 }
00486 
00487 static struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq_find_locked(struct osd_obj_map *map, u64 seq)
00488 {
00489         struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq;
00490 
00491         list_for_each_entry(osd_seq, &map->om_seq_list, oos_seq_list) {
00492                 if (osd_seq->oos_seq == seq)
00493                         return osd_seq;
00494         }
00495         return NULL;
00496 }
00497 
00498 static struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq_find(struct osd_obj_map *map, u64 seq)
00499 {
00500         struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq;
00501 
00502         read_lock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00503         osd_seq = osd_seq_find_locked(map, seq);
00504         read_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00505         return osd_seq;
00506 }
00507 
00508 void osd_obj_map_fini(struct osd_device *dev)
00509 {
00510         osd_ost_fini(dev);
00511         osd_mdt_fini(dev);
00512 }
00513 
00521 static int osd_obj_update_entry(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00522                                 struct osd_device *osd,
00523                                 struct dentry *dir, const char *name,
00524                                 const struct lu_fid *fid,
00525                                 const struct osd_inode_id *id,
00526                                 handle_t *th)
00527 {
00528         struct inode               *parent = dir->d_inode;
00529         struct dentry              *child;
00530         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
00531         struct buffer_head         *bh;
00532         struct inode               *inode;
00533         struct dentry              *dentry = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
00534         struct osd_inode_id        *oi_id  = &info->oti_id3;
00535         struct lustre_mdt_attrs    *lma    = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
00536         struct lu_fid              *oi_fid = &lma->lma_self_fid;
00537         int                         rc;
00538         ENTRY;
00539 
00540         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00541         LASSERT(th->h_transaction != NULL);
00542 
00543         child = &info->oti_child_dentry;
00544         child->d_parent = dir;
00545         child->d_name.hash = 0;
00546         child->d_name.name = name;
00547         child->d_name.len = strlen(name);
00548 
00549         ll_vfs_dq_init(parent);
00550         mutex_lock(&parent->i_mutex);
00551         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(parent, &child->d_name, &de, NULL, NULL);
00552         if (bh == NULL)
00553                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00554 
00555         if (le32_to_cpu(de->inode) == id->oii_ino)
00556                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
00557 
00558         osd_id_gen(oi_id, le32_to_cpu(de->inode), OSD_OII_NOGEN);
00559         inode = osd_iget(info, osd, oi_id);
00560         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00561                 rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00562                 if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ESTALE)
00563                         goto update;
00564                 GOTO(out, rc);
00565         }
00566 
00567         /* The EA inode should NOT be in OI, old OI scrub may added
00568          * such OI mapping by wrong, replace it. */
00569         if (unlikely(osd_is_ea_inode(inode))) {
00570                 iput(inode);
00571                 goto update;
00572         }
00573 
00574         rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, dentry, lma);
00575         if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00576                 rc = osd_get_idif(info, inode, dentry, oi_fid);
00577                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENODATA) {
00578                         oi_fid = NULL;
00579                         rc = 0;
00580                 }
00581         }
00582         iput(inode);
00583 
00584         if (rc != 0)
00585                 GOTO(out, rc);
00586 
00587         /* If the OST-object has neither FID-in-LMA nor FID-in-ff, it is
00588          * either a crashed object or a uninitialized one. Replace it. */
00589         if (oi_fid != NULL && lu_fid_eq(fid, oi_fid)) {
00590                 CERROR("%s: the FID "DFID" is used by two objects: "
00591                        "%u/%u %u/%u\n", osd_name(osd), PFID(fid),
00592                        oi_id->oii_ino, oi_id->oii_gen,
00593                        id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen);
00594                 GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00595         }
00596 
00597         if (fid_is_idif(fid) && oi_fid != NULL && fid_is_idif(oi_fid)) {
00598                 __u32 idx1 = fid_idif_ost_idx(fid);
00599                 __u32 idx2 = fid_idif_ost_idx(oi_fid);
00600                 struct ost_id *ostid = &info->oti_ostid;
00601                 struct lu_fid *tfid = &info->oti_fid3;
00602 
00603                 LASSERTF(idx1 == 0 || idx1 == osd->od_index,
00604                          "invalid given FID "DFID", not match the "
00605                          "device index %u\n", PFID(fid), osd->od_index);
00606 
00607                 if (idx1 != idx2) {
00608                         if (idx1 == 0 && idx2 == osd->od_index) {
00609                                 fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
00610                                 ostid_to_fid(tfid, ostid, idx2);
00611                                 if (lu_fid_eq(tfid, oi_fid)) {
00612                                         CERROR("%s: the FID "DFID" is used by "
00613                                                "two objects(2): %u/%u %u/%u\n",
00614                                                osd_name(osd), PFID(fid),
00615                                                oi_id->oii_ino, oi_id->oii_gen,
00616                                                id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen);
00617 
00618                                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00619                                 }
00620                         } else if (idx2 == 0 && idx1 == osd->od_index) {
00621                                 fid_to_ostid(oi_fid, ostid);
00622                                 ostid_to_fid(tfid, ostid, idx1);
00623                                 if (lu_fid_eq(tfid, fid)) {
00624                                         CERROR("%s: the FID "DFID" is used by "
00625                                                "two objects(2): %u/%u %u/%u\n",
00626                                                osd_name(osd), PFID(fid),
00627                                                oi_id->oii_ino, oi_id->oii_gen,
00628                                                id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen);
00629 
00630                                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00631                                 }
00632                         }
00633                 }
00634         }
00635 
00636 update:
00637         /* There may be temporary inconsistency: On one hand, the new
00638          * object may be referenced by multiple entries, which is out
00639          * of our control unless we traverse the whole /O completely,
00640          * which is non-flat order and inefficient, should be avoided;
00641          * On the other hand, the old object may become orphan if it
00642          * is still valid. Since it was referenced by an invalid entry,
00643          * making it as invisible temporary may be not worse. OI scrub
00644          * will process it later. */
00645         rc = ldiskfs_journal_get_write_access(th, bh);
00646         if (rc != 0)
00647                 GOTO(out, rc);
00648 
00649         de->inode = cpu_to_le32(id->oii_ino);
00650         rc = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(th, NULL, bh);
00651 
00652         GOTO(out, rc);
00653 
00654 out:
00655         brelse(bh);
00656         mutex_unlock(&parent->i_mutex);
00657         return rc;
00658 }
00659 
00660 static int osd_obj_del_entry(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00661                              struct osd_device *osd,
00662                              struct dentry *dird, char *name,
00663                              handle_t *th)
00664 {
00665         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
00666         struct buffer_head         *bh;
00667         struct dentry              *child;
00668         struct inode               *dir = dird->d_inode;
00669         int                         rc;
00670         ENTRY;
00671 
00672         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00673         LASSERT(th->h_transaction != NULL);
00674 
00675 
00676         child = &info->oti_child_dentry;
00677         child->d_name.hash = 0;
00678         child->d_name.name = name;
00679         child->d_name.len = strlen(name);
00680         child->d_parent = dird;
00681         child->d_inode = NULL;
00682 
00683         ll_vfs_dq_init(dir);
00684         mutex_lock(&dir->i_mutex);
00685         rc = -ENOENT;
00686         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(dir, &child->d_name, &de, NULL, NULL);
00687         if (bh) {
00688                 rc = ldiskfs_delete_entry(th, dir, de, bh);
00689                 brelse(bh);
00690         }
00691         mutex_unlock(&dir->i_mutex);
00692 
00693         RETURN(rc);
00694 }
00695 
00696 static int osd_obj_add_entry(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00697                              struct osd_device *osd,
00698                              struct dentry *dir, char *name,
00699                              const struct osd_inode_id *id,
00700                              handle_t *th)
00701 {
00702         struct dentry *child;
00703         struct inode *inode;
00704         int rc;
00705 
00706         ENTRY;
00707 
00708         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_COMPAT_NO_ENTRY))
00709                 RETURN(0);
00710 
00711         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00712         LASSERT(th->h_transaction != NULL);
00713 
00714         inode = info->oti_inode;
00715         if (unlikely(inode == NULL)) {
00716                 struct ldiskfs_inode_info *lii;
00717                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lii);
00718                 if (lii == NULL)
00719                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00720                 inode = info->oti_inode = &lii->vfs_inode;
00721         }
00722 
00723         inode->i_sb = osd_sb(osd);
00724         osd_id_to_inode(inode, id);
00725         inode->i_mode = S_IFREG; /* for type in ldiskfs dir entry */
00726 
00727         child = &info->oti_child_dentry;
00728         child->d_name.hash = 0;
00729         child->d_name.name = name;
00730         child->d_name.len = strlen(name);
00731         child->d_parent = dir;
00732         child->d_inode = inode;
00733 
00734         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_COMPAT_INVALID_ENTRY))
00735                 inode->i_ino++;
00736 
00737         ll_vfs_dq_init(dir->d_inode);
00738         mutex_lock(&dir->d_inode->i_mutex);
00739         rc = osd_ldiskfs_add_entry(info, th, child, inode, NULL);
00740         mutex_unlock(&dir->d_inode->i_mutex);
00741 
00742         RETURN(rc);
00743 }
00744 
00752 static inline void osd_seq_name(char *seq_name, size_t name_size, u64 seq)
00753 {
00754         snprintf(seq_name, name_size,
00755                  (fid_seq_is_rsvd(seq) ||
00756                   fid_seq_is_mdt0(seq)) ? LPU64 : LPX64i,
00757                  fid_seq_is_idif(seq) ? 0 : seq);
00758 }
00759 
00760 static inline void osd_oid_name(char *name, size_t name_size,
00761                                 const struct lu_fid *fid, u64 id)
00762 {
00763         snprintf(name, name_size,
00764                  (fid_seq_is_rsvd(fid_seq(fid)) ||
00765                   fid_seq_is_mdt0(fid_seq(fid)) ||
00766                   fid_seq_is_idif(fid_seq(fid))) ? LPU64 : LPX64i, id);
00767 }
00768 
00769 /* external locking is required */
00770 static int osd_seq_load_locked(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00771                                struct osd_device *osd,
00772                                struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq)
00773 {
00774         struct osd_obj_map  *map = osd->od_ost_map;
00775         struct dentry       *seq_dir;
00776         struct inode        *inode;
00777         struct lu_fid       *fid = &info->oti_fid3;
00778         int                 rc = 0;
00779         int                 i;
00780         char                dir_name[32];
00781         ENTRY;
00782 
00783         if (osd_seq->oos_root != NULL)
00784                 RETURN(0);
00785 
00786         LASSERT(map);
00787         LASSERT(map->om_root);
00788 
00789         osd_seq_name(dir_name, sizeof(dir_name), osd_seq->oos_seq);
00790 
00791         seq_dir = simple_mkdir(map->om_root, osd->od_mnt, dir_name, 0755, 1);
00792         if (IS_ERR(seq_dir))
00793                 GOTO(out_err, rc = PTR_ERR(seq_dir));
00794         else if (seq_dir->d_inode == NULL)
00795                 GOTO(out_put, rc = -EFAULT);
00796 
00797         inode = seq_dir->d_inode;
00798         osd_seq->oos_root = seq_dir;
00799 
00800         /* 'What the @fid is' is not imporatant, because the object
00801          * has no OI mapping, and only is visible inside the OSD.*/
00802         lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00803         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid,
00804                             LMAC_NOT_IN_OI | LMAC_FID_ON_OST, 0);
00805         if (rc != 0)
00806                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00807 
00808         LASSERT(osd_seq->oos_dirs == NULL);
00809         OBD_ALLOC(osd_seq->oos_dirs,
00810                   sizeof(seq_dir) * osd_seq->oos_subdir_count);
00811         if (osd_seq->oos_dirs == NULL)
00812                 GOTO(out_put, rc = -ENOMEM);
00813 
00814         for (i = 0; i < osd_seq->oos_subdir_count; i++) {
00815                 struct dentry   *dir;
00816 
00817                 snprintf(dir_name, sizeof(dir_name), "d%u", i);
00818                 dir = simple_mkdir(osd_seq->oos_root, osd->od_mnt, dir_name,
00819                                    0700, 1);
00820                 if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
00821                         GOTO(out_free, rc = PTR_ERR(dir));
00822                 } else if (dir->d_inode == NULL) {
00823                         dput(dir);
00824                         GOTO(out_free, rc = -EFAULT);
00825                 }
00826 
00827                 inode = dir->d_inode;
00828                 osd_seq->oos_dirs[i] = dir;
00829 
00830                 /* 'What the @fid is' is not imporatant, because the object
00831                  * has no OI mapping, and only is visible inside the OSD.*/
00832                 lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
00833                 rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid,
00834                                     LMAC_NOT_IN_OI | LMAC_FID_ON_OST, 0);
00835                 if (rc != 0)
00836                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
00837         }
00838 
00839         if (rc != 0) {
00840 out_free:
00841                 for (i = 0; i < osd_seq->oos_subdir_count; i++) {
00842                         if (osd_seq->oos_dirs[i] != NULL)
00843                                 dput(osd_seq->oos_dirs[i]);
00844                 }
00845                 OBD_FREE(osd_seq->oos_dirs,
00846                          sizeof(seq_dir) * osd_seq->oos_subdir_count);
00847 out_put:
00848                 dput(seq_dir);
00849                 osd_seq->oos_root = NULL;
00850         }
00851 out_err:
00852         RETURN(rc);
00853 }
00854 
00855 static struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq_load(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00856                                         struct osd_device *osd, u64 seq)
00857 {
00858         struct osd_obj_map      *map;
00859         struct osd_obj_seq      *osd_seq;
00860         int                     rc = 0;
00861         ENTRY;
00862 
00863         map = osd->od_ost_map;
00864         LASSERT(map);
00865         LASSERT(map->om_root);
00866 
00867         osd_seq = osd_seq_find(map, seq);
00868         if (likely(osd_seq != NULL))
00869                 RETURN(osd_seq);
00870 
00871         /* Serializing init process */
00872         mutex_lock(&map->om_dir_init_mutex);
00873 
00874         /* Check whether the seq has been added */
00875         read_lock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00876         osd_seq = osd_seq_find_locked(map, seq);
00877         if (osd_seq != NULL) {
00878                 read_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00879                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = 0);
00880         }
00881         read_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00882 
00883         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osd_seq);
00884         if (osd_seq == NULL)
00885                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = -ENOMEM);
00886 
00887         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&osd_seq->oos_seq_list);
00888         osd_seq->oos_seq = seq;
00889         /* Init subdir count to be 32, but each seq can have
00890          * different subdir count */
00891         osd_seq->oos_subdir_count = map->om_subdir_count;
00892         rc = osd_seq_load_locked(info, osd, osd_seq);
00893         if (rc != 0)
00894                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00895 
00896         write_lock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00897         list_add(&osd_seq->oos_seq_list, &map->om_seq_list);
00898         write_unlock(&map->om_seq_list_lock);
00899 
00900 cleanup:
00901         mutex_unlock(&map->om_dir_init_mutex);
00902         if (rc != 0) {
00903                 if (osd_seq != NULL)
00904                         OBD_FREE_PTR(osd_seq);
00905                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00906         }
00907 
00908         RETURN(osd_seq);
00909 }
00910 
00911 int osd_obj_map_lookup(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00912                        const struct lu_fid *fid, struct osd_inode_id *id)
00913 {
00914         struct osd_obj_map              *map;
00915         struct osd_obj_seq              *osd_seq;
00916         struct dentry                   *d_seq;
00917         struct dentry                   *child;
00918         struct ost_id                   *ostid = &info->oti_ostid;
00919         int                             dirn;
00920         char                            name[32];
00921         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2      *de;
00922         struct buffer_head              *bh;
00923         struct inode                    *dir;
00924         struct inode                    *inode;
00925         ENTRY;
00926 
00927         /* on the very first lookup we find and open directories */
00928 
00929         map = dev->od_ost_map;
00930         LASSERT(map);
00931         LASSERT(map->om_root);
00932 
00933         fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
00934         osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, dev, ostid_seq(ostid));
00935         if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
00936                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
00937 
00938         dirn = ostid_id(ostid) & (osd_seq->oos_subdir_count - 1);
00939         d_seq = osd_seq->oos_dirs[dirn];
00940         LASSERT(d_seq);
00941 
00942         osd_oid_name(name, sizeof(name), fid, ostid_id(ostid));
00943 
00944         child = &info->oti_child_dentry;
00945         child->d_parent = d_seq;
00946         child->d_name.hash = 0;
00947         child->d_name.name = name;
00948         /* XXX: we can use rc from sprintf() instead of strlen() */
00949         child->d_name.len = strlen(name);
00950 
00951         dir = d_seq->d_inode;
00952         mutex_lock(&dir->i_mutex);
00953         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(dir, &child->d_name, &de, NULL, NULL);
00954         mutex_unlock(&dir->i_mutex);
00955 
00956         if (bh == NULL)
00957                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00958 
00959         osd_id_gen(id, le32_to_cpu(de->inode), OSD_OII_NOGEN);
00960         brelse(bh);
00961 
00962         inode = osd_iget(info, dev, id);
00963         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00964                 int rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00965 
00966                 RETURN(rc == -ENOENT ? -ESTALE : rc);
00967         }
00968 
00969         iput(inode);
00970         RETURN(0);
00971 }
00972 
00973 int osd_obj_map_insert(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00974                        struct osd_device *osd,
00975                        const struct lu_fid *fid,
00976                        const struct osd_inode_id *id,
00977                        handle_t *th)
00978 {
00979         struct osd_obj_map      *map;
00980         struct osd_obj_seq      *osd_seq;
00981         struct dentry           *d;
00982         struct ost_id           *ostid = &info->oti_ostid;
00983         u64                      oid;
00984         int                     dirn, rc = 0;
00985         char                    name[32];
00986         ENTRY;
00987 
00988         map = osd->od_ost_map;
00989         LASSERT(map);
00990 
00991         /* map fid to seq:objid */
00992         fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
00993 
00994         oid = ostid_id(ostid);
00995         osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, ostid_seq(ostid));
00996         if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
00997                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
00998 
00999         dirn = oid & (osd_seq->oos_subdir_count - 1);
01000         d = osd_seq->oos_dirs[dirn];
01001         LASSERT(d);
01002 
01003         osd_oid_name(name, sizeof(name), fid, oid);
01004 
01005 again:
01006         rc = osd_obj_add_entry(info, osd, d, name, id, th);
01007         if (rc == -EEXIST) {
01008                 rc = osd_obj_update_entry(info, osd, d, name, fid, id, th);
01009                 if (unlikely(rc == -ENOENT))
01010                         goto again;
01011 
01012                 if (unlikely(rc == 1))
01013                         RETURN(0);
01014         }
01015 
01016         RETURN(rc);
01017 }
01018 
01019 int osd_obj_map_delete(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *osd,
01020                        const struct lu_fid *fid, handle_t *th)
01021 {
01022         struct osd_obj_map      *map;
01023         struct osd_obj_seq      *osd_seq;
01024         struct dentry           *d;
01025         struct ost_id           *ostid = &info->oti_ostid;
01026         int                     dirn, rc = 0;
01027         char                    name[32];
01028         ENTRY;
01029 
01030         map = osd->od_ost_map;
01031         LASSERT(map);
01032 
01033         /* map fid to seq:objid */
01034         fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
01035 
01036         osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, ostid_seq(ostid));
01037         if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01038                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
01039 
01040         dirn = ostid_id(ostid) & (osd_seq->oos_subdir_count - 1);
01041         d = osd_seq->oos_dirs[dirn];
01042         LASSERT(d);
01043 
01044         osd_oid_name(name, sizeof(name), fid, ostid_id(ostid));
01045         rc = osd_obj_del_entry(info, osd, d, name, th);
01046 cleanup:
01047         RETURN(rc);
01048 }
01049 
01050 int osd_obj_map_update(struct osd_thread_info *info,
01051                        struct osd_device *osd,
01052                        const struct lu_fid *fid,
01053                        const struct osd_inode_id *id,
01054                        handle_t *th)
01055 {
01056         struct osd_obj_seq      *osd_seq;
01057         struct dentry           *d;
01058         struct ost_id           *ostid = &info->oti_ostid;
01059         int                     dirn, rc = 0;
01060         char                    name[32];
01061         ENTRY;
01062 
01063         fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
01064         osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, ostid_seq(ostid));
01065         if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01066                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
01067 
01068         dirn = ostid_id(ostid) & (osd_seq->oos_subdir_count - 1);
01069         d = osd_seq->oos_dirs[dirn];
01070         LASSERT(d);
01071 
01072         osd_oid_name(name, sizeof(name), fid, ostid_id(ostid));
01073         rc = osd_obj_update_entry(info, osd, d, name, fid, id, th);
01074 
01075         RETURN(rc);
01076 }
01077 
01078 int osd_obj_map_recover(struct osd_thread_info *info,
01079                         struct osd_device *osd,
01080                         struct inode *src_parent,
01081                         struct dentry *src_child,
01082                         const struct lu_fid *fid)
01083 {
01084         struct osd_obj_seq         *osd_seq;
01085         struct dentry              *tgt_parent;
01086         struct dentry              *tgt_child = &info->oti_child_dentry;
01087         struct inode               *dir;
01088         struct inode               *inode     = src_child->d_inode;
01089         struct ost_id              *ostid     = &info->oti_ostid;
01090         handle_t                   *jh;
01091         struct ldiskfs_dir_entry_2 *de;
01092         struct buffer_head         *bh;
01093         char                        name[32];
01094         int                         dirn;
01095         int                         rc        = 0;
01096         ENTRY;
01097 
01098         if (fid_is_last_id(fid)) {
01099                 osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, fid_seq(fid));
01100                 if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01101                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
01102 
01103                 tgt_parent = osd_seq->oos_root;
01104                 tgt_child->d_name.name = "LAST_ID";
01105                 tgt_child->d_name.len = strlen("LAST_ID");
01106         } else {
01107                 fid_to_ostid(fid, ostid);
01108                 osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, ostid_seq(ostid));
01109                 if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01110                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
01111 
01112                 dirn = ostid_id(ostid) & (osd_seq->oos_subdir_count - 1);
01113                 tgt_parent = osd_seq->oos_dirs[dirn];
01114                 osd_oid_name(name, sizeof(name), fid, ostid_id(ostid));
01115                 tgt_child->d_name.name = name;
01116                 tgt_child->d_name.len = strlen(name);
01117         }
01118         LASSERT(tgt_parent != NULL);
01119 
01120         dir = tgt_parent->d_inode;
01121         tgt_child->d_name.hash = 0;
01122         tgt_child->d_parent = tgt_parent;
01123         tgt_child->d_inode = inode;
01124 
01125         /* The non-initialized src_child may be destroyed. */
01126         jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(osd), LDISKFS_HT_MISC,
01127                                 osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_DELETE] +
01128                                 osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_INSERT] +
01129                                 osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_OBJECT_DELETE]);
01130         if (IS_ERR(jh))
01131                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(jh));
01132 
01133         ll_vfs_dq_init(src_parent);
01134         ll_vfs_dq_init(dir);
01135 
01136         mutex_lock(&src_parent->i_mutex);
01137         mutex_lock(&dir->i_mutex);
01138         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(dir, &tgt_child->d_name, &de, NULL, NULL);
01139         if (bh != NULL) {
01140                 /* XXX: If some other object occupied the same slot. And If such
01141                  *      inode is zero-sized and with SUID+SGID, then means it is
01142                  *      a new created one. Maybe we can remove it and insert the
01143                  *      original one back to the /O/<seq>/d<x>. But there are
01144                  *      something to be considered:
01145                  *
01146                  *      1) The OST-object under /lost+found has crashed LMA.
01147                  *         So it should not conflict with the current one.
01148                  *
01149                  *      2) There are race conditions that: someone may just want
01150                  *         to modify the current one. Even if the OI scrub takes
01151                  *         the object lock when remove the current one, it still
01152                  *         cause the modification to be lost becasue the target
01153                  *         has been removed when the RPC service thread waiting
01154                  *         for the lock.
01155                  *
01156                  *      So keep it there before we have suitable solution. */
01157                 brelse(bh);
01158                 mutex_unlock(&dir->i_mutex);
01159                 mutex_unlock(&src_parent->i_mutex);
01160                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
01161 
01162                 rc = -EEXIST;
01163                 /* If the src object has never been modified, then remove it. */
01164                 if (inode->i_size == 0 && inode->i_mode & S_ISUID &&
01165                     inode->i_mode & S_ISGID) {
01166                         rc = ll_vfs_unlink(src_parent, src_child);
01167                         if (unlikely(rc == -ENOENT))
01168                                 rc = 0;
01169                 }
01170                 RETURN(rc);
01171         }
01172 
01173         bh = osd_ldiskfs_find_entry(src_parent, &src_child->d_name, &de,
01174                                     NULL, NULL);
01175         if (unlikely(bh == NULL))
01176                 GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENOENT);
01177 
01178         rc = ldiskfs_delete_entry(jh, src_parent, de, bh);
01179         brelse(bh);
01180         if (rc != 0)
01181                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
01182 
01183         rc = osd_ldiskfs_add_entry(info, jh, tgt_child, inode, NULL);
01184 
01185         GOTO(unlock, rc);
01186 
01187 unlock:
01188         mutex_unlock(&dir->i_mutex);
01189         mutex_unlock(&src_parent->i_mutex);
01190         ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
01191         return rc;
01192 }
01193 
01194 static struct dentry *
01195 osd_object_spec_find(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *osd,
01196                      const struct lu_fid *fid, char **name)
01197 {
01198         struct dentry *root = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
01199 
01200         if (fid_is_last_id(fid)) {
01201                 struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq;
01202 
01203                 /* on creation of LAST_ID we create O/<seq> hierarchy */
01204                 osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, fid_seq(fid));
01205                 if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01206                         RETURN((struct dentry *)osd_seq);
01207 
01208                 *name = "LAST_ID";
01209                 root = osd_seq->oos_root;
01210         } else {
01211                 *name = osd_lf_fid2name(fid);
01212                 if (*name == NULL)
01213                         CWARN("UNKNOWN COMPAT FID "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
01214                 else if ((*name)[0])
01215                         root = osd_sb(osd)->s_root;
01216         }
01217 
01218         return root;
01219 }
01220 
01221 int osd_obj_spec_update(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *osd,
01222                         const struct lu_fid *fid, const struct osd_inode_id *id,
01223                         handle_t *th)
01224 {
01225         struct dentry   *root;
01226         char            *name = NULL;
01227         int              rc;
01228         ENTRY;
01229 
01230         root = osd_object_spec_find(info, osd, fid, &name);
01231         if (!IS_ERR(root)) {
01232                 rc = osd_obj_update_entry(info, osd, root, name, fid, id, th);
01233         } else {
01234                 rc = PTR_ERR(root);
01235                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01236                         rc = 1;
01237         }
01238 
01239         RETURN(rc);
01240 }
01241 
01242 int osd_obj_spec_insert(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *osd,
01243                         const struct lu_fid *fid, const struct osd_inode_id *id,
01244                         handle_t *th)
01245 {
01246         struct dentry   *root;
01247         char            *name = NULL;
01248         int              rc;
01249         ENTRY;
01250 
01251         root = osd_object_spec_find(info, osd, fid, &name);
01252         if (!IS_ERR(root)) {
01253                 rc = osd_obj_add_entry(info, osd, root, name, id, th);
01254         } else {
01255                 rc = PTR_ERR(root);
01256                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01257                         rc = 0;
01258         }
01259 
01260         RETURN(rc);
01261 }
01262 
01263 int osd_obj_spec_lookup(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *osd,
01264                         const struct lu_fid *fid, struct osd_inode_id *id)
01265 {
01266         struct dentry   *root;
01267         struct dentry   *dentry;
01268         struct inode    *inode;
01269         char            *name = NULL;
01270         int             rc = -ENOENT;
01271         ENTRY;
01272 
01273         if (fid_is_last_id(fid)) {
01274                 struct osd_obj_seq *osd_seq;
01275 
01276                 osd_seq = osd_seq_load(info, osd, fid_seq(fid));
01277                 if (IS_ERR(osd_seq))
01278                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(osd_seq));
01279                 root = osd_seq->oos_root;
01280                 name = "LAST_ID";
01281         } else {
01282                 root = osd_sb(osd)->s_root;
01283                 name = osd_lf_fid2name(fid);
01284                 if (name == NULL || strlen(name) == 0)
01285                         RETURN(-ENOENT);
01286         }
01287 
01288         dentry = ll_lookup_one_len(name, root, strlen(name));
01289         if (!IS_ERR(dentry)) {
01290                 inode = dentry->d_inode;
01291                 if (inode) {
01292                         if (is_bad_inode(inode)) {
01293                                 rc = -EIO;
01294                         } else {
01295                                 osd_id_gen(id, inode->i_ino,
01296                                            inode->i_generation);
01297                                 rc = 0;
01298                         }
01299                 }
01300                 /* if dentry is accessible after osd_compat_spec_insert it
01301                  * will still contain NULL inode, so don't keep it in cache */
01302                 d_invalidate(dentry);
01303                 dput(dentry);
01304         }
01305 
01306         RETURN(rc);
01307 }
